2013 EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



INDSPEC Chemical Corporation, a wholly-owned subsidiary of INDSPEC Holding Corporation, is owner and operator of a Resorcinol manufacturing facility in Petrolia, PA. INDSPEC also manufactures resorcinol-based resins and other resorcinol derivatives.  INDSPEC's quality materials, strong environmental and safety policies combined with a reliable supply chain and customer service, secures its position as an industry leader in resorcinol. 



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (? 68.155(a))



As a RESPONSIBLE CARE; Company, INDSPEC Chemical Corporation has established systems for the safe operation of the processes at this facility that facilitates the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances. INDSPEC's focus is on workplace and environmental safety which is good for the environment as well as protecting our employees and our surrounding communities.  One component of these systems is a program to manage the risks of accidental releases at the Petrolia, PA facility.  This program conforms to the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR PART 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirement Risk Management Programs (the RMP rule) and requirements of OSHA 1910.119. This document is intended to satisfy the RMP plan requirement of the RMP rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at the Petrolia, PA facility.



The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled (AA? 68.155(b))



The INDSPEC Chemical Corporation Petrolia facility handles 3 substances that are regulated by the RMP rule.  The facility conducted a threshold determination consistent with 40 CFR 68.115 and has identified three substances that are regulated under the Risk Management Plan (RMP): Oleum (CAS Number 8014-95-7), Formaldehyde (CAS Number 50-00-0) and Ethyl Ether (CAS Number 60-29-7). 





Review of Worst-case and Alternate Releas

e Scenarios (? 68.155(c))



INDSPEC provides the following release scenarios:

?Worst-case Toxics:  INDSPEC has determined that a release of oleum would constitute a worst-case release toxic release for the facility therefore has developed the impact scenario for this release.



?Worst-case Flammables:  INDSPEC has determined that a release of diethyl ether would constitute a worst-case flammable event for the facility therefore has developed the impact scenario for this event.



?Alternative Releases Toxics:  INDSPEC has provided alternate release scenarios for individual releases of oleum, and formaldehyde.



?Alternative Releases Flammables:  INDSPEC has provided an alternate release scenario for a flammable release of diethyl ether.  

 



The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Specific Prevention Steps (? 68.155(d))



The INDSPEC Chemical Corporation Petrolia facility's prevention program has been prepared to be consistent with OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management Plan regulations.  The site's prevention program is documented, routinely reviewed, updated as necessary, and addresses several elements including:



?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training

?    Mechanical Integrity

?    Management of Change

?    Pre-Startup Review

?    Compliance Audits

?    Incident Investigation

?    Employee Participation

?    Key Procedures

?    Contractor Safety Program





Five-year Accident History (? 68.155(e))



The INDSPEC Chemical Corporation Petrolia facility has not experienced any accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage within the past 5 years.





Emergency Response Program (AA? 68.155(f))



The Petrolia, PA facility has established a written emergency response plan and maintains an emergency respo

ties.





Planned Changes to Improve Safety (AA? 68.155(g))



The INDSPEC Petrolia facility continually works to improve safety through:

?    Annual reviews of our plant process safety information, 

?    Safety Procedures including Key Procedures for operation and maintenance, 

?    Training for all employees in relevant procedures; Instructor Led Training, Hands on Training, and online Web Based Training 

?    Investigations of near misses and incidents, and 

?    Engagement of all site employees on matters of safety and environmental
